cs.cscollections.utilities
Class SinglyLinkedList<T>

java.lang.Object
  cs.cscollections.utilities.SinglyLinkedList<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class SinglyLinkedList<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>

The SinglyLinkedList class provides a utility class for implementing collections as a singly linked list. If collection is ordered, then the template parameter type T must implement the Comparable ADT in order to provide a ordering for elements.

Version:
v 1.0 3/2015
Author:
S. Sigman

Constructor Detail

public SinglyLinkedList()

Method Detail

getDataFromHead

public T getDataFromHead()

getDataFromHead returns the data from the first node in the list. Invoking this method on an empty list is an exception. The list should either be checked to verify it is not empty before calling this method, or the call should be nested in a try-catch block.

Returns:
The data from the first node in the list.
Throws:
EmptyCollectionException
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#getDataFromHead()

getDataFromTail

public T getDataFromTail()
getDataFromTail returns the data from the last node in the list. Invoking this method on an empty list is an exception. The list should either be checked to verify it is not empty before calling this method, or the call should be nested in a try-catch block.

Returns:
The data from the last node in the list.
Throws:
EmptyCollectionException
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#getDataFromTail()

getIth

public T getIth(int i)

getIth returns the data from the ith node in the list. Nodes in the list are numbered starting from 0. So, 0 <= i < size of the list. Invoking this method on an empty list is an exception. The list should either be checked to verify it is not empty before calling this method, or the call should be nested in a try-catch block.

Parameters:
i - The position in the element in the list.
Returns:
The data in the ith node.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException, - EmptyCollectionException

getSize

public int getSize()

Reports the number of elements in the list.

Returns:
The number of elements in the list.
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#getSize()

insertAfter

public void insertAfter(T target,
                        T ele)

insertAfter inserts the specified element (ele) after the target element. If the target is not found in the list an IllegalInsertionException is thrown. Type T must implement the Comparable interface.

If it is not know whether the target element is in the list, calls to insertAfter should be nested in a try catch block as illustrated below:


       T target = ... //reference to target element
       T ele = ...    //reference to element to insert
       try {
           insertAfter(target, ele);
       }
       catch IllegalInsertionException(e)
       {
           // Inset the element into the list using another insertion method or
           // take corrective action.
       }

Parameters:
target - The element of the list to insert after.
ele - The element to insert into the list.
Throws:
IllegalInsertionException

insertAtHead

public void insertAtHead(T ele)

insertAtHead inserts the specified element at the head of the singly linked list.

Parameters:
ele - The element to insert
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#insertAtHead(T)

insertAtTail

public void insertAtTail(T ele)

insertAtTale inserts the specified element at the tail of a singly linked list. Caution: this method's performance is linear in the lenght of the list, O(n).

See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#insertAtTail(int)

insertIth

public void insertIth(T ele,
                      int pos)

Inserts the specified element at the specified position in the list. Note that the new element is in position pos in the list after the insert. pos must be in the range 0 .. size().

Parameters:
ele - The element to insert.
pos - The position in the list in which to insert the new element.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()

Reports whether the singly linked list is empty or not.

Returns:
True if there are no elements in the list. Otherwise, false is returned.
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#isEmpty()

iterator

public java.util.Iterator<T> iterator()
This method returns an iterator defined over the list.

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<T>
Returns:
Iterator for the linked list.

orderedInsert

public void orderedInsert(T ele)

orderedInsert inserts the specified inorder in the list. Type T must define an order on elements by implementing the Comparable interface.

Parameters:
ele - The element to insert.

remove

public void remove(T target)

remove removes the node containing the object specified by target from the list. Invoking this method on an empty list is an exception. The list should either be checked to verify it is not empty before calling this method, or the call should be nested in a try-catch block.

Parameters:
target - The target object to remove from the list.
Throws:
EmptyCollectionException

removeFromHead

public void removeFromHead()

removeFromHead removes the first element from the list. Note that removing from an empty list is not considered an error. Removing from an empty list leaves an empty list.

removeFromTail

public void removeFromTail()
removeFromTail removes the last element in the list. Note that removing from an empty list is not considered an error. Removing from an empty list leaves an empty list.

See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#removeFromTail()

removeIth

public void removeIth(int pos)

removeIt removes the ith node from the list. Nodes are enumerated starting at 0. Invoking this method on an empty list is an exception. The list should either be checked to verify it is not empty before calling this method, or the call should be nested in a try-catch block.

Parameters:
pos - The position of the element in the list.
Throws:
EmptyCollectionException, - IndexOutOfBoundsException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

toString returns a string version of the list. It requires that the template type, T, implement toString.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A string representation of the list.
See Also:
cs.cscollections.utilities.LinkedListADT#toString()
